reasoning: Deep infiltrating endometriosis (DIE) is a specific severe subtype affecting approximately 0.65% of global population (~2-4% of reproductive-age women). Measured as prevalence (chronic condition), not incidence. Represents roughly 20-30% of endometriosis cases, with lower prevalence than general endometriosis due to severity/specificity.
source: Garcia-Solares J et al. (2018). Pathogenesis of uterine adenomyosis: an update. Fertil Steril. 109(5):803-816. Based on estimates that deep endometriosis comprises 15-30% of endometriosis cases with overall prevalence of 2-4% in reproductive-age women.
